instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2850 A Not power on
threads.message:
hi,
there was a picture on the device, but there was a square on the screen,so i removed the video card, reballing it and plugged it in. but  the fan keeps turning and stopping , it keeps doing the same thing it turns. orj 85 watt apt. no battery 

SCL = 3.421 Voltage fixed
SDA = 3.421 Voltage fixed

Diyot mode
SCL=0.505
SDA=0.504

F7040 = 12.57 Voltage fixed

i tried SMC bypass = the fan spins 1 time at full speed and stops then spins again at normal speed and stops

threads.title: 820-2850 A Not power on
threads.message:
Something wrong happened reworking GPU.
Maybe knocked off components, or heat affected other components.

Why didn't disable GPU???

threads.title: 820-2850 A Not power on
threads.message:
The customer asked for the graphics card to be repaired.

I disconnected the video card from the motherboard but the device does not turn on

where do we check?

how can i do UMA gpu disable  easiest

threads.title: 820-2850 A Not power on
threads.message:
Is it normal that the device does not turn on when the video card chip is not on it?

no fan spin

c9560 pin 1 = 1,3 voltage voltage comes and goes
L7415 pin 1 = 1,0 voltage voltage comes and goes

threads.title: 820-2850 A Not power on
threads.message: GPU presence is not needed to boot the board.

threads.title: 820-2850 A Not power on
threads.message:
c9560 pin 1 = 1,3 voltage voltage comes and goes
L7415 pin 1 = 1,0 voltage voltage comes and goes

threads.title: 820-2850 A Not power on
threads.message: Knocked off components, or CPU damaged by overheat...
